entities.name: luna lovegood
entities.description: Luna Lovegood is mentioned as a person who reads The Quibbler upside down because of her interest in ancient runes.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is the main character who is reading the magazine and reacting to its content.

entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is mentioned as a person who might have many faults but it's hard for Harry to imagine him ordering goblins to be cooked in pies.

entities.name: tutshill tornados
entities.description: Tutshill Tornados are a Quidditch team that is accused of winning the league through unfair means.

entities.name: cleansweep six
entities.description: Cleansweep Six is mentioned as a broomstick used by a wizard to fly to the moon and bring back moon frogs.

entities.name: moon frogs
entities.description: Moon frogs are creatures that were brought back from the moon by a wizard on a Cleansweep Six.

entities.name: quibbler
entities.description: The Quibbler is a magazine that Luna Lovegood reads upside down due to her interest in ancient runes.

relationships.description: Harry finds it hard to imagine Fudge ordering goblins to be cooked in pies.
Tutshill Tornados are accused of winning the Quidditch League through unfair means.
A wizard flew to the moon on a Cleansweep Six and brought back moon frogs.
